title: Partizan Belgrade vs Manchester United, Europa League: live score and latest updates
text:
Manchester United face Partizan Belgrade for the first time in European competition since the 1965-66 season, and the fixture will always have a special resonance for the club.

The Busby Babes were on a stop over in Munich after playing Partizan in the 1958 European Cup when eight players, three staff members, eight journalists and two other passengers perished in the Munich Air Disaster.

Ed Woodward, Bryan Robson, Mickey Thomas and other Manchester United representatives laid a wreath at a special ceremony to mark the tragedy at Partizan's stadium this week.

On the pitch, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's team are feeling a bit better about themselves after a spirited draw against rivals Liverpool in which their tactical approach worked a treat.

United's away form will now be tested with four away games in succession in all competitions, and they are without an away victory of any kind since that remarkable night against PSG in March.

A well-resourced Premier League team has to go some to fail to qualify from the Europa League group stage, but United still need to get the points on the board after drawing their last game against AZ Alkmaar.

As seems to be the case in every United match there are injuries to contend with. Paul Pogba, Luke Shaw, Nemanja Matic, Axel Tuanzebe and Diogo Dalot are all out while David De Gea did not travel.

Jesse Lingard could return from injury, but youngsters Mason Greenwood and Brandon Williams are likely to get chances to impress. Under-23 full-back Ethan Laird is also part of the squad.

Partizan are unbeaten in their last 11 home games in this competition and United will face a hostile atmosphere.

Asked about United's dodgy away for, Solskjaer said: "It’s a question we’ve asked ourselves as well, after I came in we won nine on the bounce and since then we haven’t won any it’s an issue we have to deal with, sort out as soon as possible, we’ve got four games away on the trot and hopefully those statistics will turn."
description: Manchester United face Partizan Belgrade for the first time in European competition since the 1965-66 season, and the fixture will always have a special resonance for the club.
